Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2009 03:14PM LizFL wrote: Before I gave up and had my rings resized, I used to spray the ring and finger with Windex and it made it easier to slide off.  My lymphedema is on my right side, but I get swelling in both hands from time to time (plus I've gained weight).  The jeweler that made my rings is the one that suggested Windex, as if you use anything oily it can loosen the stones.  The Windex kind of cleans it up a bit too!  I used to fill a small travel sized spray bottle with Windex and take it with me when I travelled and kept it in the medicine cabinet at home to remove my rings before going to bed.  Liz
Posts.Title: Tight wedding ring solution Binney4 Kate33

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2009 01:44AM LizFL wrote: I wonder if it would be possible to have the bra you purchased sewn into the dress...like they are sewn into camisole tops?  As long as the dress fit well, I would think it would stay up.  Just an idea, don't really know if it would work as I guess a lot would depend on the style of the dress.  Liz
Posts.Title: Please help Megan0164 Megan0164

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2008 12:37AM - edited Sep 7, 2008 12:38AM by LizFL I faithfully went for mammograms every year.  Had a history of cysts and dense breasts and usually had an ultra sound along with the mammo.  Six months after a normal mammo/us I was diagnosed with BC at stage 3C, borderline 4 and grade 3.  I did not feel a lump, just some soreness on the side of my breast that didn't go away and the skin developed a reddish color so I made an appointment to have it checked out.  I was so sure that even it did turn out to be cancer that I would be catching it very early....wrong again!  The good news is that was over three years ago and I am sitll NED.  I am due for a mammo in October and plan on requesting an MRI.  Hopefully I won't have probems with my insurance company. Liz
